He developed a system of measurement based on the human body, which included units of length, volume, and weight. This system was later adopted by the ancient Romans and became the basis for many modern measurement systems.

(Original screen width x Original screen height) / (Television screen width x Television screen height)
For example, if the original movie has a screen width of 2.35 times the screen height (2.35:1 aspect ratio), and the television screen has a width of 4 times the height (4:3 aspect ratio), we can calculate the amount of the movie that can fit on the television screen as follows:
(2.35 x 1.25) / (4 x 1.33) = 0.67
So, approximately 67% of the original movie can fit on a television screen with a 4:3 aspect ratio.
